page.title: 01General Review of the Area
page.content: The area of 12 square kilometres covered by this survey all lies within the county of Gloucestershire. Most of it is in the parish of Ashchurch, but it also includes small parts of the parishes of Teddington and Oxenton.It is all low lying land in the Lower Severn Valley except at the extreme SE corner; here there is Oxenton Hill, an outlier of the Cotswolds.It is mostly farmland though there is a large modern housing development at the NW corner, at Northway.Here there is also the large factory of Dowty Mining. Other factories lie just outside the area near the M5 motorway.Further E are the church, our school and the large Army Vehicle Depot. The main-line railway (to Birmingham)cuts through here from N to S.The busy A438 trunk road also passes from E to W right by our school.
